arch_conf.name: Description
arch_conf.value: The MIPS processor was developed by Dr.John Hennessey and his graduate students at Stanford University in the early 1980s. It is currently one of the major processors in the embedded processor market.

instructions.name: abs.d
instructions.help: Absolute value of a real 64-bit number.

instructions.name: abs.s
instructions.help: Absolute value of a real 32-bit number.

instructions.name: add
instructions.help: Sum with overflow

instructions.name: add.d
instructions.help: Add the register fs and ft and store the result in fd (double)

instructions.name: add.s
instructions.help: Add the register fs and ft and store the result in fd (float)

instructions.name: addi
instructions.help: Add an immediate number with overflow

instructions.name: addiu
instructions.help: Add an immediate number without overflow

instructions.name: and
instructions.help: AND logical operation

instructions.name: andi
instructions.help: AND logical operation with an immediate number

instructions.name: bgez
instructions.help: Conditional branch if the Rsrc register is greater than or equal to 0.

instructions.name: bgezal
instructions.help: Conditional branch if the Rsrc register is greater than or equal to 0. Save the current address in the $ra register ($31)

instructions.name: bgtz
instructions.help: Conditional branch if Rsrc is greater than 0.

instructions.name: blez
instructions.help: Conditional branch if Rsrc is less than or equal to 0.

instructions.name: bltz
instructions.help: Conditional branch if Rsrc is less than 0.

instructions.name: c.eq.d
c.eq.s
c.ole.d
c.ole.s
c.olt.d
c.olt.s
cvt.d.s
instructions.help: Turn a float into a double, the result is saved in fd

instructions.name: cvt.d.w
instructions.help: Convert an integer to a double, the result is saved in fd

instructions.name: cvt.s.d
instructions.help: Turn a double into a float, the result is saved in fd

instructions.name: cvt.s.w
instructions.help: Convert an integer into a float, the result is saved in fd

instructions.name: cvt.w.d
instructions.help: Convert a double into an integer, the result is saved in Rdest

instructions.name: cvt.w.s
instructions.help: Convert a float into an integer, the result is saved in Rdest

instructions.name: div
instructions.help: Divide with overflow

instructions.name: div
instructions.help: Divide with overflow. Leave the quotient in the register lo and the rest in the register hi

instructions.name: div.d
instructions.help: Divide fs by ft and leave the result in fd (double)

instructions.name: div.s
instructions.help: Divide fs by ft and leave the result in fd (float)

instructions.name: divu
instructions.help: Divide without overflow

instructions.name: divu
instructions.help: Divide without overflow. Leave quotient in the register lo and the rest in the register hi

instructions.name: j
instructions.help: Unconditional jump.

instructions.name: jal
instructions.help: Unconditional jump, stores the current address at $ ra ($31).

instructions.name: jalr
instructions.help: Unconditional jump, stores the current address in Rsrc1.

instructions.name: jr
instructions.help: Unconditional jump.

instructions.name: ldc1
lh
instructions.help: Load 16 bits of the specified address, sign is extended

instructions.name: lhu
instructions.help: Load 16 bits of the specified address, no sign is extended

instructions.name: lui
instructions.help: Load the 16 bits of the lower part of the immediate value in the upper part of the register. The bits of the lower part are set to 0

instructions.name: lw
instructions.help: Load a word from the specified address

instructions.name: mfc1
instructions.help: Moves the contents of the CPsrc register of the floating-point coprocessor to the Rdest CPU register.

instructions.name: mfhi
instructions.help: Move the contents of the HI register to the Rdest register.

instructions.name: mflo
instructions.help: Move the contents of the LO register to the Rdest register.

instructions.name: mod
instructions.help: Division module with overflow

instructions.name: modu
instructions.help: Division module without overflow

instructions.name: mov.d
instructions.help: Move the contents of the fs record to the fd record. (double)

instructions.name: mov.s
instructions.help: Move the contents of the fs record to the fd record. (float)

instructions.name: mtc1
instructions.help: Move the contents of the Rsrc register of the CPU to the CPdest register of the floating-point coprocessor.

instructions.name: mthi
instructions.help: Move the contents of the Rsrc register to the HI register.

instructions.name: mtlo
instructions.help: Move the contents of the Rsrc register to the LO register.

instructions.name: mul.d
instructions.help: Multiply the register fs and ft and leave your result in fd. (double)

instructions.name: mul.s
instructions.help: Multiply the register fs and ft and leave your result in fd. (float)

instructions.name: mult
instructions.help: Multiply, the low part of the result is left in the lo register and the high part in the hi register

instructions.name: multu
instructions.help: Multiply without overflow, the low part of the result is left in the lo register and the high part in the hi register

instructions.name: nop
instructions.help: It does not perform any operation

instructions.name: nor
instructions.help: NOR Logic Operation

instructions.name: or
instructions.help: OR Logic Operation

instructions.name: ori
instructions.help: OR Logic Operation with immediate

instructions.name: rotr
instructions.help: Right rotation of inm bits

instructions.name: rsqrt.d
instructions.help: Reciprocal Square Root fd = 1.0/sqrt.s(fs) (double)

instructions.name: rsqrt.s
instructions.help: Reciprocal Square Root fd = 1.0/sqrt.s(fs) (float)

instructions.name: sh
instructions.help: Stores the low half word (16 bits) of a register in the indicated memory address.

instructions.name: sll
instructions.help: Logical bit shift to the left

instructions.name: slt
instructions.help: Set Rdest to 1 if Rsrc1 is less than Rsrc2, otherwise set 0 (for signed numbers).

instructions.name: slti
instructions.help: Set Rdest to 1 if Rsrc1 is less than inm, otherwise set 0 (for signed numbers).

instructions.name: sltiu
instructions.help: Set Rdest to 1 if Rsrc1 is less than inm, otherwise set 0 (for unsigned numbers).

instructions.name: sltu
instructions.help: Set Rdest to 1 if Rsrc1 is less than Rsrc2, otherwise set 0 (for unsigned numbers).

instructions.name: sqrt.d
instructions.help: Square root of fs (double)

instructions.name: sqrt.s
instructions.help: Square root of fs (float): fd=sqrt(fs)

instructions.name: sra
instructions.help: Arithmetic bit shift to the right

instructions.name: srl
instructions.help: Logical bit shift to the right

instructions.name: sub
instructions.help: Subtraction (with overflow)

instructions.name: sub.d
instructions.help: Subtraction (double)

instructions.name: sub.s
instructions.help: Subtraction (float): fd = fs-ft

instructions.name: subu
instructions.help: Subtraction (without overflow)

instructions.name: sw
instructions.help: Store the Rsrc in the indicated address.

instructions.name: syscall
xor
instructions.help: XOR Logic Operation

instructions.name: xori
instructions.help: XOR Logic Operation with immediate number

instructions.name: rfe
instructions.help: Return from exception

pseudoinstructions.name: add
addu
and
bgt
pseudoinstructions.definition: addi $at $zero inm; addi $at $at 1; slt $at $reg1 $at; beq $at $zero off;

pseudoinstructions.name: ble
pseudoinstructions.definition: addi $at $zero inm; addi $at $at 1; slti $at $reg1 inm; bne $at $zero off;

pseudoinstructions.name: bleu
pseudoinstructions.definition: ori $at $zero inm; beq $at $reg1 off; sltu $at $reg1 $at; bne $at $zero off;

pseudoinstructions.name: la
lb
lbu
lh
lhu
li
li.d
lw
mul
nor
or
sb
sh
sub
subu
sw
xor
